title: Bug 10403 - Project creation confirmation for scrubbing bin directory
EB: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, there should be a confirmation message to ensure that the output directory (bin) can be deleted and rebuilt. Currently, some users are creating projects and pointing the output folder to a bin directory that contains more than just .class files, which can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
SR:
To reproduce this issue: 
1. Open the IDE 
2. Create a new project 
3. Select an existing directory structure for the project 
4. Set the output directory to a bin directory that contains extra files 
5. Confirm that a message is displayed, asking if the bin directory can be deleted and rebuilt.
